doc:
Harry Basch https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Basch 0 Harry Basch (born January 16, 1926) is an American actor and author. In 1951 he appeared in "Mr. Roberts" at the Curran Theatre in San Francisco. He is possibly best known for his role as Vince Caproni in the 1980s television series Falcon Crest. He appeared in the series from 1982 to 1984. He also appeared as "Dr Brown" in the Star Trek episode "What Are Little Girls Made Of?" in 1966. In addition to acting, Basch has written several articles for the Los Angeles Times about traveling. He and his late wife, actress Shirley Slater, also wrote several books on the subject including RV Vacations for Dummies. Harry Basch ( born January_16_,_1926 ) is an_American_actor_and_author . In 1951 he appeared in " Mr._Roberts " at the_Curran_Theatre in San_Francisco . He is_possibly_best_known for his_role as Vince_Caproni in the_1980s_television_series_Falcon_Crest . He appeared in the_series from 1982 to 1984 . He also appeared as "_Dr_Brown " in the_Star_Trek_episode " What Are Little_Girls Made Of ? " in 1966 . In addition to acting , Basch has_written several_articles for the_Los_Angeles_Times about traveling . He and his_late_wife , actress_Shirley_Slater , also wrote several_books on the_subject_including_RV_Vacations for Dummies .
